element.name: TCustomScrollBar
element.descr: Custom Scroll Bar: the base type from which Control Bars are derived

element.name: TScrollBar
element.descr:
Scroll Bar for Text Box or Memo. Can be none, horizontal, vertical or both. May appear automatically when the text goes outside the window.
Scroll codes may be line up or down, page up or down, track the mouse, top of panel, bottom of panel, or end scroll.

element.name: TCustomGroupBox
element.descr: Custom Group Box: the base type from which Group Box and related components are derived.

element.name: TGroupBox
element.descr:
Group Box. Allows a number of objects to be grouped physically and conceptually on the form; they can be moved around together and have certain properties in common.
They share the same scope for several variables, which are hidden from objects outside the group.
They can interact with one another, for example radio buttons will be mutually exclusive within the group.

element.name: TComboBoxStyle
element.descr: ComboBox Style: may be Simple, a Drop-Down or a drop-down list, or some version drawn by the Owner

element.name: TCustomComboBox
element.descr: Custom Combination Box: the base class from which Combo Box is derived.

element.name: TComboBox
element.descr: Combo box. A simple combination of text box for free text entry, and a drop-down list allowing one of several options to be chosen.

element.name: TCustomListBox
element.descr: Custom List Box: the base type from which List Box is derived.

element.name: TListBox
element.descr: List Box: a simple drop-down list from which a choice is made

element.name: TCustomEdit
element.descr: Custom Edit: the base type from which Edit Box is derived.

element.name: TCustomEdit.MaxLength
element.descr: Max Length: maximum length allowed for text string

element.name: TCustomEdit.Modified
element.descr: Modified: has the text been modified since creation?

element.name: TCustomEdit.PasswordChar
element.descr: Password Character: the character which appears in the Edit box replacing and masking the actual character typed. Typically used in password input, to prevent the typed characters from being seen by passers-by or casual observers (or even malicious observers!)

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelLength
element.descr: Sel Length: the length (in characters) of the text that has been selected for editing

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelStart
element.descr: Sel Start: the index of the character from which selection (for editing) begins

element.name: TCustomEdit.SelText
element.descr: Sel Text: the text of the actual string that has been selected for editing

element.name: TCustomEdit.Text
element.descr: Text: the character string contained in the Edit Box

element.name: TCustomMemo
element.descr: Custom Memo: the base type from which Memo is derived

element.name: TCustomMemo.Create
element.descr: Create the Custom memo widget

element.name: TCustomMemo.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy the CustomMemo widget when you have finished with it

element.name: TCustomMemo.Lines
element.descr: Lines: an array of strings (representing single lines of characters) which contains the textual material held or being entered in the Memo.

element.name: TCustomMemo.WordWrap
element.descr: Word Wrap: a logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word nears the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line

element.name: TEdit
element.descr:
Edit Box: for entry or display of a single line of text.
Inherits most of its properties from TCustomEdit

element.name: TEdit.Action
element.descr:
Action: the task to be performed when the component is activated by a mouse movement or key press.
This should point to a user-defined procedure or function or an item on an action list.

element.name: TEdit.Align
element.descr: Align: Is used to align a Control component to a border of a parent control.

element.name: TEdit.Anchors
element.descr: Anchors: keep the edges of a control component a defined distance from certain borders of the parent control.

element.name: TEdit.Constraints
element.descr:
Constraints: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control.
If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here.
You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.

element.name: TEdit.CharCase
element.descr: Character Case: the default character case (Upper or Lower case) to be used in the Edit Box. Can, of course, be over-ridden by use of the [shift] key.

element.name: TEdit.Enabled
element.descr: Enabled: flag to determine whether or not the control is able to be used

element.name: TEdit.OnChange
element.descr:
On Change - Action to be taken when any of the properties of the control change (especially the textual content).
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnChangeBounds
element.descr:
On Change Bounds - Action to be taken if any of the bounds of the control are changed.
User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TEdit.OnClick
element.descr: On Click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is clicked with the cursor over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnEnter
element.descr: On Entry - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor or text cursor enters the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnExit
element.descr: On Exit - Action to be taken when the mouse or text cursor leaves this control or when focus is relinquished. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnKeyDown
element.descr:
On Key Down - Action to be taken if a key is down while focus is in this control. Subtly different from On Key Pressed - for example the key might already have been down when focus entered this control, whereas On Key Pressed requires the key to become pressed while focus is in the control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnKeyPress
element.descr:
On Key Press - Action to be taken if a key becomes pressed while focus is in this control. Subtly different from On Key Down, which simply responds to a key being down, whether or not it was already down when focus was given to this control. On Key Press requires that a key becomes pressed while focus in in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnKeyUp
element.descr:
On Key Up - Action to be taken if a key is up (ie not pressed) while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnMouseDown
element.descr:
On Mouse Down - Action to be taken if the mouse button is down while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnMouseMove
element.descr:
On Mouse Move - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnMouseUp
element.descr:
On Mouse Up - Action to be taken if the mouse button is up (not pressed) while focus is in this control.
User -defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.OnResize
element.descr:
On Resize - Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TEdit.PasswordChar
element.descr:
Password Character - defines which character should appear in the edit box when a password is being typed.
A security feature to prevent casual onlookers fom seeing the password that is being entered.
Most often an asterisk * but could be any user-selected character.

element.name: TEdit.PopupMenu
element.descr: Popup Menu - a menu that appears when the right mouse button is clicked over this control

element.name: TEdit.ReadOnly
element.descr: Read Only - a flag that signifies that users can view the contents of this control but are not allowed to modify it.

element.name: TEdit.ShowHint
element.descr: Show Hint - allows a small box containing helpful text to be displayed while the mouse cursor 'hovers' over the control

element.name: TEdit.Text
element.descr: Text - the actual character string that represents the contents of the control. May be edited if ReadOnly property is not set

element.name: TEdit.Visible
element.descr: Visible - determines whether or not the control can be seen

element.name: TMemo
element.descr:
Memo box: for entry or display of multiple lines of text.
Inherits most of its properties from TCustomMemo

element.name: TMemo.Lines
element.descr: Lines: an array of strings (representing single lines of characters) which contains the textual material held or being entered in the Memo.

element.name: TMemo.MaxLength
element.descr: Max Length: the maximum permitted length for the textual material in the memo

element.name: TMemo.WordWrap
element.descr: Word Wrap: a logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word nears the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line

element.name: TCustomLabel
element.descr: Custom label: the base type from which Label is derived.

element.name: TLabel
element.descr:
Label: a brief text label to be placed in the Form near any object that needs to be identified.
Can also be used for displaying text messages, eg
...
Label.Caption := 'Please select one of these options';
...
or the message may be changed dynamically, eg
var Lies: boolean;
...
if (Lies=true) then Label.caption := 'Lies are true'
else Label.caption := 'Lies are false';
...

element.name: TLabel.Align
element.descr: Align: Is used to align a Control component to a border of a parent control.

element.name: TLabel.Anchors
element.descr: Anchors: keep the edges of a control component a defined distance from certain borders of the parent control.

element.name: TLabel.Caption
element.descr: Caption - the text string that represents the contents of the label

element.name: TLabel.Constraints
element.descr:
Constraints: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control.
If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here.
You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.

element.name: TLabel.OnChangeBounds
element.descr:
On Change Bounds - Action to be taken if any of the bounds of the control are changed.
User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TLabel.OnClick
element.descr: On Click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is clicked with the cursor over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnDblClick
element.descr:
On Double-click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is double-clicked with the cursor over this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnMouseDown
element.descr:
On Mouse Down - Action to be taken if the mouse button is down while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnMouseEnter
element.descr: On Mouse Entry - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor enters the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnMouseLeave
element.descr: On Mouse Leaving - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor leaves the boundaries of this control. User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TLabel.OnMouseMove
element.descr: On Mouse Movement - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves while within the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnMouseUp
element.descr:
On Mouse Up - Action to be taken if the mouse button is up while the cursor is over this control.
Implies that the mouse button was previously down and has been released. The case where the cursor enters the control but the mouse button has not yet been pressed is covered by OnMouseEnter.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.OnResize
element.descr: On Resize - Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TLabel.Visible
element.descr: Visible - determines whether or not the control can be seen

element.name: TLabel.WordWrap
element.descr: Word Wrap: a logical flag to show whether or not word-wrap is enabled, ie if a word is near the end of a line and is going to be too long for the line, it is wrapped down to the next line

element.name: TButtonControl
element.descr:
Button Control: Base Type for the Button (including Radio Button) and Check Box types ;
processes the detection of clicks and changes, and the checked/unchecked state of the component.
A rectangular button, whose shape can be specified, and which usually has an informative caption.
It is designed to be pressed or selected by the mouse cursor, and usually initiates some activity with the OnClick Event.
Properties can include [Checked], [Click] (mouse clicks on button) and the actions to be taken on a change in a property.
Typically, clicking on the box will cause the box to be checked (or unchecked if it is already checked) as well as initiating any other action associated with the box.
The programmer is responsible for ensuring that the appropriate actions and changes in checked status are performed.

element.name: TCheckBoxState
TCheckBoxState.cbUnchecked
element.descr: The check box has no check mark, indicating that the user has not selected the option.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbChecked
element.descr: The check box has a check mark in it, indicating that the user has selected the option.

element.name: TCheckBoxState.cbGrayed
element.descr: The check box has a check mark in it, but it is grayed.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox
element.short: TCustomCheckBox is the ancestor of all check-box components.
element.descr: Custom Check Box: The base (abstract) class from which the TCheckBox is derived. Check boxes present the user with options that can be selected (checked) or deselected (unchecked).

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.AllowGrayed
element.short: Determines whether the check box can be in a "grayed" state.
element.descr: If AllowGrayed is set to True, the check box has three possible states: checked, unchecked and grayed. If AllowGrayed is set to False, the check box has only two possible states: checked and unchecked.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.State
element.short: Indicates whether the check box is selected, deselected or grayed.
element.descr: See TCheckBoxState for possible values of State.

element.name: TCustomCheckBox.TabStop
element.short: Determines if the user can tab to a control.
element.descr:
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If the TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't press the Tab key to move to the control.

element.name: TCheckBox
element.descr:
Check Box: a small box which can contain a check mark to indicate that it has been selected by a mouse click. May be associated with a Caption that describes its function.
Toggles between being checked and unchecked on successive clicks of the mouse, and usually initiates some action associated with OnChecked.

element.name: TCheckBox.Action
element.descr:
Action: the task to be performed when the component is activated by a mouse movement or key press.
This should point to a user-defined procedure or function or an item on an action list.

element.name: TCheckBox.Align
element.descr: Align: Is used to align a Control component to a border of a parent control.

element.name: TCheckBox.AllowGrayed
element.descr:
Allow Grayed: a flag to show whether the box is allowed to be Greyed out,
ie it is still visible, but appears faint and cannot be selected or activated with the mouse cursor or keyboard

element.name: TCheckBox.Anchors
element.descr: Anchors: keep the edges of a control component a defined distance from certain borders of the parent control.

element.name: TCheckBox.Caption
element.descr: Caption: a brief description appearing near the check box, usually stating the function of the box or what action will be taken if it becomes checked.

element.name: TCheckBox.Checked
element.descr: Checked - shows whether or not the box has been checked (ie selected)

element.name: TCheckBox.Constraints
element.descr:
Constraints: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control.
If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here.
You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.

element.name: TCheckBox.Enabled
element.descr: Enabled: flag to determine whether or not the control is able to be used

element.name: TCheckBox.Hint
element.descr:
Hint: a short piece of pop-up text that appears if the mouse-cursor hovers over the check box;
it should give further details of the function of the box

element.name: TCheckBox.OnChange
element.descr:
On Change - Action to be taken when any of the properties of the control change.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnChangeBounds
element.descr:
On Change Bounds - Action to be taken if any of the bounds of the control are changed.
User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TCheckBox.OnClick
element.descr:
On Click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is clicked with the cursor over this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnEnter
element.descr: On Entry - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor or text cursor enters the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnExit
element.descr:
On Exit - Action to be taken when the mouse or text cursor leaves this control or when focus is relinquished.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnMouseDown
element.descr:
On Mouse Down - Action to be taken if the mouse button is down while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnMouseMove
element.descr:
On Mouse Move - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves while focus is in this control.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnMouseUp
element.descr:
On Mouse Up - Action to be taken if the mouse button is up (not pressed) while focus is in this control.
User -defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.OnResize
element.descr:
On Resize - Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include selection of a different font size etc.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TCheckBox.PopupMenu
element.descr: Popup Menu - a menu that appears when the right mouse button is clicked over this control

element.name: TCheckBox.ShowHint
element.descr: Show Hint: a flag to show whether or not the hint is to be shown when the mouse cursor hovers over the box.

element.name: TCheckBox.Visible
element.descr: Visible - determines whether or not the control can be seen

element.name: TToggleBox
element.descr:
Toggle Box: a labelled box capable of being checked (when it becomes recessed) or unchecked (when it is raised).
The 'state' property can be tested for cbUnchecked or cbChecked and actions can be associated with mouse clicks or other movements

element.name: TRadioButton
element.descr:
Radio Button: a button which works in conjunction with other Radio Buttons in a mutually exclusive manner - if one button of a group is selected, none of the others in that group can be selected.
Several radio buttons are usually grouped together in a Group Box or Radio Group. When a button is selected, the actions associated with that button are initiated.

element.name: TCustomStaticText
element.descr: Custom Static Text: the base type from which Static Text is derived.

element.name: TStaticText
element.descr: Static Text: a box to display a Constant Text String

element.name: TStaticText.Align
element.descr: Align: Is used to align a Static Text box to a border of a parent control.

element.name: TStaticText.Anchors
element.descr: Anchors: keep the edges of a static text box a defined distance from certain borders of the parent control.

element.name: TStaticText.Caption
element.descr: Caption: the text that actually appears with the Static Text Box

element.name: TStaticText.Constraints
element.descr:
Constraints: Sets the minimum and maximum sizes for a control.
If a control is resized the new dimensions are always within the ranges given here.
You should take care when setting these options that they do not conflict with the Anchors and Align settings.

element.name: TStaticText.Enabled
element.descr: Enabled: flag to determine whether or not the control is able to be used

element.name: TStaticText.PopupMenu
element.descr: Popup Menu - a menu that appears when the right mouse button is clicked over this control

element.name: TStaticText.ShowHint
element.descr: Show Hint - allows a small box containing helpful text to be displayed while the mouse cursor 'hovers' over the control

element.name: TStaticText.Visible
element.descr: Visible - determines whether or not the control can be seen

element.name: TStaticText.OnClick
element.descr: On Click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is clicked with the cursor over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnDblClick
element.descr: On Double-click - Action to be taken when the mouse button is double-clicked while the cursor is over the control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseDown
element.descr: On Mouse Down - Action to be taken when the mouse button is down while the cursor is over this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseMove
element.descr: On Mouse Movement - Action to be taken if the mouse cursor moves within the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseUp
element.descr:
On Mouse Up - Action to be taken if the mouse button is up while the cursor is over this control.
Implies that the mouse button was previously down and has been released. The case where the cursor enters the control but the mouse button has not yet been pressed is covered by OnMouseEnter.
User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseEnter
element.descr: On Mouse Entry - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor enters the bounds of this control. User-defined Procedure

element.name: TStaticText.OnMouseLeave
element.descr: On Mouse Leaving - Action to be taken when the mouse cursor leaves the boundaries of this control. User-defined Procedure.

element.name: TStaticText.OnResize
element.descr: On Resize - Action to be taken when the control is resized. Might include re-alignment of text or selection of a different font size etc. User-defined Procedure
